usefulItems: loaf tin (900 g/2 lb), baking paper, wire rack, skewer, oven
title: Mocha Cake

ingredients.content: 200 g unsalted butter, diced, plus extra for greasing
1 Tbsp instant coffee, dissolved in 3 Tbsp milk

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C. Grease and line a loaf tin (900 g/2 lb) with baking paper, with enough overhang to make it easy to remove cake.
Place butter and sugar in mixing bowl then cream <b>30 sec/speed 3<b>.
Without measuring cup, set <b>speed 3<b> and add eggs, one at a time, through hole in mixing bowl lid.
Add flour and baking powder then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.

Add coffee mixture and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to prepared tin and level surface. Bake for 50-60 minutes (170°C) until a skewer inserted in centre comes out almost clean. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Leave in tin to cool for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Place butter in mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/75°C/speed 0.5<b>.

Without measuring cup, set <b>speed 1<b> then add icing sugar, 40 g milk and vanilla through hole in mixing bowl lid (see tip). Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>. Pour or spoon over cooled cake on wire rack so that it drizzles down sides.
Leave icing to set for approx. 1 hour then slice and serve.

hintsAndTricks: If icing looks too dry, add up to <b>10 g<b> more milk before mxing again in <b>step 9.<b>
